name: Twisted Fate
title: the Card Master

P.name: Loaded Dice

effects.description: Innate: Every time Twisted Fate kills an enemy, he gains 1 − 6 (based on probability).
Since his dice are loaded, Twisted Fate has an increased chance of gaining 6.

P.notes: The expected bonus gold gained per unit killed is  4.
P.blurb: Upon killing a unit, Twisted Fate rolls his 'lucky' dice receiving anywhere between 1 and 6 bonus gold.

Q.name: Wild Cards

effects.description: Active: Twisted Fate unleashes three cards in a cone in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies they pass through.
Enemies can only be damaged once by Wild Cards.

Q.notes: Wild Cards will cast from wherever Twisted Fate is at the end of the cast time.
Q.blurb: Twisted Fate throws three cards, dealing damage to each enemy unit they pass through.

W.name: Pick a Card

effects.description: Active: Twisted Fate cycles through three cards for 6 seconds, hovering each for 0.5 seconds at a time. Pick a Card can be recast for the duration, and doing so chooses the current card hovered, empowering Twisted Fate's next basic attack within 6 seconds to have a 0.25-second cast time, deal modified magic damage, and apply an additional effect based on the card selected. This attack applies both on-hit and spell effects, but cannot critically strike.
Recast - Red Card: Deals magic damage to all enemies around the target and slows them for 2.5 seconds.
Recast - Gold Card: Stuns the target.
Pick a Card's recast can be used while affected by crowd control.

W.notes:
The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as Spellblade and stacking  Force Pulse.
Recasting the ability does not.
The enhanced attack triggers against  turrets but not jungle plants and  wards. It will not trigger against any other structures.
Pick a Card triggers on-hit effects and thus will stack and trigger  Stacked Deck.
The first card shown is random but the order always remains the same ( Blue Card,  Red Card,  Gold Card, repeat).
Upon activation, an indicator visible to allies and enemies appears above Twisted Fate to show him shuffling his deck of cards while remaining in the same order, the card he can choose at every moment glows over the others. The selected card is specified for the duration of the enhanced attack.
 𝐏𝐄𝐍𝐃𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐓𝐄𝐒𝐓  The interval until the next card is hovered is 0.528 seconds every time, instead of some times 0.528 and other times 0.495.
W.blurb: Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.

E.name: Stacked Deck

effects.description: Passive: Twisted Fate gains bonus attack speed.
Twisted Fate gains a stack of Stacked Deck from basic attacks on-hit, stacking up to 3 times.
At 3 stacks, his next basic attack on-hit consumes all stacks to deal bonus magic damage.

E.notes:
Stacked Deck's enhanced attack does not apply to structures nor will it be consumed against them.
Stacked Deck can be  dodged and/or missed if Twisted Fate is  blinded (the on-hit effect is not consumed in either case) but cannot be  blocked (the enhanced attack is consumed and the bonus damage is still applied).
E.blurb: Every 4 attacks, Twisted Fate deals bonus damage. In addition, his Attack Speed is increased.

R.name: Destiny

effects.description: Active: Twisted Fate summons an identifying eyeball above all targetable enemy champions for a few seconds, revealing them for the duration. Destiny can be recast after 0.5 seconds for its duration.
Recast: Twisted Fate channels for 1.5 seconds, then blinks to the target location upon completion, destroying all projectiles targeting him in the process.

R.notes:
The second cast's name is Gate.
Both casts count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as Spellblade and stacking  Force Pulse.
Twisted Fate cannot recast Destiny while  grounded or  rooted.
The  nearsight from  Paranoia will overpower the  reveal from Destiny regardless of which one was cast first (enemy champions can still be revealed by Destiny after Paranoia ends if durations permit).
Using the recast will inform allies with a ping.
Both allies and enemies can see an indicator at the targeted location of where Twisted Fate will appear.
The following table refers for interactions while Twisted Fate is  channeling:

Trying to cast a disabled active will buffer it to cast at the completion of the channel.
R.blurb: Twisted Fate predicts the fortunes of his foes, revealing all enemy champions and enabling the use of Gate, which teleports Twisted Fate to any target location in 1.5 seconds.

lore: Twisted Fate is an infamous cardsharp and swindler who has gambled and charmed his way across much of the known world, earning the enmity and admiration of the rich and foolish alike. He rarely takes things seriously, greeting each day with a mocking smile and an insouciant swagger. In every possible way, Twisted Fate always has an ace up his sleeve.

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: Twisted Fate is an infamous cardsharp and swindler who has gambled and charmed his way across much of the known world, earning the enmity and admiration of the rich and foolish alike. He rarely takes things seriously, greeting each day with a mocking smile and an insouciant swagger. In every possible way, Twisted Fate always has an ace up his sleeve.

skins.name: PAX
skins.lore: A special event skin given away at PAX 2009.

skins.name: Jack of Hearts
skins.lore:
Second, the Jack, with a thunderous crack
Trounces fate in the blink of an eye!
In winnings he counts all the hearts of the court
Who will swoon every time he walks by.

skins.name: High Noon
skins.lore: Resident cardsharp of every dice parlour and gambling den on the high frontier, Tobias 'Twisted Fate' Felix likes to split his time between Buzzard Gulch, and the more civilized border towns. He specializes in breaking the hearts and bank accounts—in either order—of amiably naive debutantes.

skins.name: Underworld
skins.lore: For those dreading their inevitable meeting with Death, Twisted Fate offers another path. If they win his game of chance, a life of luxury awaits them. If they lose, he gladly adds yet another card to his ever-growing deck of doomed souls.

skins.name: Red Card
skins.lore: Tobias spends much of his spare time as a sanctioned referee for Order United matches. Sure, there are card games to cheat at, and gambling parlors to swindle, but it just doesn't compare to a heated game of soccer.

skins.name: Cutpurse
skins.lore: Looking to hire some muscle for an above-the-board, highly legitimate business venture? Look no further than Twisted Fate and his furry companion Graves, two men who will do anything (and we mean anything) to anybody (and we mean anybody) for the right price (any price). Inquire within!

skins.name: Blood Moon
skins.lore: The Blood Moon cult's true leader is shrouded in whispers and hearsay. It is he who first passed the trial of the masks, and he who unraveled the secrets of surrendering one's flesh to the demon spirits. Whether he is still human, none can say—but he is ever present, and always watching.

skins.name: Pulsefire

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2020 Pulsefire event.

skins.lore: Swindling his way past the chrono-enforcers, Twisted Fate has made himself known by pulling off grand heists, across various timelines. Always just moments ahead of the law, with stolen riches in his pocket, he knows the alleyways of time make for the quickest of getaways…

skins.name: Odyssey

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2020 Worlds event.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: A space smuggler erroneously known for discretion, as well as his impractically famous ship, The Wildcard, Twisted Fate was hired by Karma to free some templars from some space pirates. He has only just begun to notice that the other mercs on the job are better known for wetwork than simple heists...
